talk.author: did:plc:vq3sqrg5aard2dw4ngittxtv
talk.utter: I recognised the cars üòÖ seriously it's good to see Brussels getting up from its knees and not worshipping cars so much. It will be such a beautiful city without them!

talk.author: did:plc:2pchbolosbg5qmgb4ftoibcr
talk.utter: It's getting there. I remember the downtown area when it was a sooty, traffic-clogged mess,and it's so much better now. There's still a lot of work going on, but it'll get there.

talk.author: did:plc:2pchbolosbg5qmgb4ftoibcr
talk.utter: It's getting there. I remember the downtown area when it was a sooty, traffic-clogged mess,and it's so much better now. There's still a lot of work going on, but it'll get there.

talk.author: did:plc:vq3sqrg5aard2dw4ngittxtv
talk.utter: do you still have the motorway going right through the centre of the city? I mean that is a STATEMENT.

talk.author: did:plc:vq3sqrg5aard2dw4ngittxtv
talk.utter: Just did my own research! I was mistaken: I was thinking of the R20 which is not a motorway (just feels like one if you're a pedestrian) and circumnavigates the very centre. Maybe conflated it with the Boulevarde Anspach as well.

talk.author: did:plc:2pchbolosbg5qmgb4ftoibcr
talk.utter: Yes, that's commonly regfered to as the pentagon, and it's wild.  But Anspach is now pedestrian as well.
